title: Van Kush Family Temple Pharmacopoeia
subtitle: Botanical Preparations, Extraction Science, and Formulation Frameworks
purpose: Knowledgebase integration and AI character training

section_1_cannabinoid_oilahuasca.title: Cannabinoid Oilahuasca Framework
section_1_cannabinoid_oilahuasca.concept: Extends traditional ayahuasca pharmacology to the endocannabinoid system. Just as classical ayahuasca combines DMT with MAO inhibitors, Cannabinoid Oilahuasca combines cannabinoids with MAGL and FAAH inhibitors to potentiate endocannabinoid signaling.

MAGL.notes: Responsible for 85% of 2-AG hydrolysis in the brain. Inhibiting MAGL elevates 2-AG levels and reduces arachidonic acid (inflammatory precursor)

FAAH.function: Degrades anandamide (AEA), the other major endocannabinoid
FAAH.notes: Inhibiting FAAH elevates anandamide levels, producing anxiolytic and analgesic effects

natural_MAGL_inhibitors.mechanism: IC50 = 9.5 μM; most potent natural MAGL inhibitor identified; also potent phytoestrogen; promotes neurogenesis
Reversible MAGL inhibitor; terpenoid; less selective

natural_MAGL_inhibitors.source: Black pepper, cloves, cannabis, Imphepho, Yin Chen Hao
natural_MAGL_inhibitors.mechanism: Dietary CB2 agonist; FDA GRAS status; anti-inflammatory without psychoactivity

natural_FAAH_inhibitors.mechanism: Piperidine alkaloid; FAAH and endocannabinoid reuptake inhibitor

piperaceae_connection.description: The Piperaceae family (pepper family) contains multiple compounds affecting the endocannabinoid system
piperaceae_connection.black_pepper: Contains guineensine (FAAH/reuptake inhibitor) and piperine (bioavailability enhancer)
piperaceae_connection.kava: Contains yangonin and other kavalactones affecting CB1
piperaceae_connection.significance: This family represents a rich source for Oilahuasca formulation

myrcene_entourage.mechanism: Increases BBB permeability, potentially enhancing cannabinoid uptake into the brain
myrcene_entourage.folk_practice: Eating mango before cannabis consumption has pharmacological basis
myrcene_entourage.additional_properties: Sedative, analgesic, and anti-inflammatory properties independent of cannabinoid modulation

THC_O_acetate.description: Acetylated prodrug of THC with enhanced lipophilicity and potentially greater BBB penetration
THC_O_acetate.mechanism: Acetyl group cleaved by esterases after absorption, releasing active THC
THC_O_acetate.parallel: Prodrug approach parallels heroin (diacetylmorphine) vs morphine pharmacokinetics
THC_O_acetate.note: Legal status varies; documented for research purposes

section_2_bio_oil_replacement.title: Edible Bio-Oil Replacement Formula
section_2_bio_oil_replacement.concept: A dual-use cosmeceutical that works topically AND can be consumed orally. Everything food-grade throughout. Inspired by Egyptian temple ointment traditions.

food_grade_replacement.function: Fast absorption, antimicrobial, replaces mineral oil
Mimics skin sebum (like PurCellin claims), shelf-stable
Wound healing, scar reduction, CB2 agonist (β-caryophyllene)
Real antioxidant form, not acetate ester
Active form, not weak retinyl palmitate

calendula_AREDS2_connection.description: Calendula officinalis (pot marigold) is the primary natural source of lutein and zeaxanthin - the same carotenoids in the AREDS-2 eye health formula
calendula_AREDS2_connection.content: Marigold flowers contain approximately 80% lutein and 5% zeaxanthin
calendula_AREDS2_connection.accumulation: These carotenoids accumulate in both the macula (retina) and the skin, protecting against oxidative damage
calendula_AREDS2_connection.AREDS2_formula: 10mg lutein, 2mg zeaxanthin reduces AMD progression by 25%
calendula_AREDS2_connection.concept: An edible skin cream functions as an AREDS-2 replacement through dual topical/oral route. Fat-soluble carotenoids are better absorbed with oils

compounds.name: Carnosic acid
compounds.mechanism: ROS quencher, converts to ortho-quinone under oxidative stress, activates NRF2 pathway

compounds.name: Rosmarinic acid
compounds.mechanism: Metal chelation, prevents Fenton reaction oxidation

rosemary_antioxidant.applications: EU/US/Japan approved as food additive (E392), replaces synthetic BHA/BHT/TBHQ. Cosmetic usage at 0.2-2% extends shelf life
rosemary_antioxidant.iron_fence_claim: Validated - carnosic acid donates electrons to neutralize free radicals before substrate oxidation occurs

section_3_imphepho.title: Imphepho (Helichrysum) Pharmacology
section_3_imphepho.description: Several South African Helichrysum species used traditionally for ukuphahla (ancestral communication rituals). Botanical cousins of Italian Immortelle (Helichrysum italicum), one of the most expensive essential oils (~$2000/liter). South African species share similar compounds but remain largely uncommercialized.

species_profiles.major_compounds: Faurinone (20.66% - first identification in this species), (E)-β-Ocimene (17.21%)
α-Pinene, 1,8-Cineole as major constituents; 4,5-Dicaffeoylquinic acid as marker compound

pharmacological_properties: Wound healing: Antimicrobial activity, tissue regeneration (same mechanism as Italian Immortelle)
Scar reduction: Collagenase/elastase inhibition via β-diketones (italidione in H. italicum)
Anti-inflammatory: Multiple pathways including CB2 activation via β-caryophyllene
Antioxidant: Moderate to high capacity (especially H. odoratissimum in FRAP/ORAC assays)
CNS effects: Smoke condensates contain different compounds than solvent extracts
traditional_uses: Burned as incense for ukuphahla (IsiXhosa: 'Impepho', IsiZulu: 'Imphepho')
Wound dressing: Ash from burnt plant combined with fresh/dried aerial parts
Tea (boiled in water or milk): Coughs, colds, fever, menstrual pain, headaches, insomnia, hypertension
Smoke inhalation: Pain relief, respiratory conditions

smoke_profile.finding: Smoke condensates from burning Imphepho contain different compounds than solvent extracts
smoke_profile.implication: Chemical changes occur during combustion. Five major compounds were common to both H. odoratissimum and H. petiolare smoke, explaining their interchangeable use in traditional rituals
smoke_profile.application: Implications for vaporization vs combustion delivery methods

distillation_parameters.example: For 113g (1/4 lb) dried herb, expect approximately 0.17-0.28 mL essential oil
distillation_parameters.byproduct: Hydrosol is valuable for toners and sprays
distillation_parameters.method: Steam distillation preferred for terpene preservation

section_4_yin_chen_hao.title: Yerba Lena Yesca / Yin Chen Hao (Artemisia capillaris)
section_4_yin_chen_hao.description: One of the most important liver herbs in Chinese pharmacopoeia, with over 2000 years of documented use. Western herbal markets sell it as 'Yerba Lena Yesca' and market it as 'psychoactive,' which obscures its serious hepatoprotective applications.

key_bioactives.activity: Promotes bile secretion, hepatocyte regeneration, anti-inflammatory, increases dopamine release in PC12 cells
Inhibits β-glucuronidase (enhances liver detox), antioxidant, protects against apoptosis via HO-1 pathway
Antioxidant, regulates bile secretion, reduces gallbladder damage

pharmacological_effects: Choleretic: Enhances gallbladder contraction, increases bile acid/phospholipid/cholesterol secretion
Hepatoprotective: Promotes hepatocyte regeneration, protects cell membrane integrity
Anti-inflammatory: Reduces transaminases, prevents hepatocyte necrosis
Antioxidant: Anti-lipid peroxidation, free radical scavenging
Antisteatotic: Reduces cholesterol/triglycerides in liver tissue

TCM_context.first_documentation: Divine Husbandman's Herbal Foundation Canon (Shennong Bencao Jing)
TCM_context.traditional_applications: Jaundice, cirrhosis, hepatitis, liver cancer support
TCM_context.harvest_timing: 'Yin Chen in February, Hao in March, lumber for burning in May' (二月茵陳三月蒿,五月茵陳當柴燒). Spring harvest yields maximum bioactive content
TCM_context.naming: Spring = 'Yin Chen Hao', summer = 'Mian Yin Chen'

liver_brain_axis.description: Liver health directly impacts brain function through:
pathways: Bile acid signaling (FXR receptors affect neurotransmitters)
liver_brain_axis.connection: Connects Yin Chen Hao to nootropic stack work (L-Methylfolate, Galantamine) via metabolic support pathways

section_5_mucuna_extraction.title: Mucuna Pruriens L-DOPA Extraction
section_5_mucuna_extraction.description: Natural source of L-DOPA (levodopa), the direct precursor to dopamine. Seeds contain approximately 3.1-6.1% L-DOPA by weight. Used in traditional Ayurvedic medicine for 'Kampavata' (now understood as Parkinson's disease) since 1500 BC.

solubility_challenge.issue: L-DOPA is an amino acid (3,4-dihydroxyphenylalanine) that is water-soluble, not fat/oil-soluble
solubility_challenge.problem: Raw Mucuna powder does not dissolve well in VG/PG vape bases because the powder contains plant fibers, starches, and other insolubles
solubility_challenge.commercial_solution: Products like Hyla Dopa vapes use pre-extracted Mucuna pruriens extract, not raw powder

ethanol_extraction.solution: 50% ethanol with ascorbic acid (protects L-DOPA from oxidation)

degradation_warning.issue: L-DOPA degrades rapidly - up to 52% degradation observed in extracts
degradation_warning.mechanism: Oxidizes to dopaquinone and other harmful quinones
degradation_warning.recommendation: Fresh extracts should be used promptly or properly stabilized

vape_formulation_protocol: Step 1: Extract Mucuna powder with acidified water (citric acid + ascorbic acid)
Step 2: Filter through silk screen, then coffee filter
Step 3: Concentrate extract (gentle heat, don't go completely dry)
Step 4: Mix concentrated extract into VG/PG base (start 10% extract, 90% VG/PG)
Step 5: Store in dark, cool place; monitor for color changes (darkening = oxidation)
section_5_mucuna_extraction.VG_PG_ratio: 50/50 or 60PG/40VG for better extract solubility. Higher PG content improves dissolution of water-soluble compounds

section_6_beta_caryophyllene.title: β-Caryophyllene as Unifying Compound
section_6_beta_caryophyllene.discovery: Multiple botanicals in the Van Kush Family inventory contain β-caryophyllene, a dietary CB2 cannabinoid receptor agonist. This creates a unified cannabinoid system across preparations without requiring cannabis.
properties: Sesquiterpene found in black pepper, cloves, hops, cannabis, copaiba, rosemary
Selective CB2 agonist (does not activate CB1, therefore non-psychoactive)
FDA GRAS (Generally Recognized as Safe) status as food additive

legal_cannabinoid_modulation.description: β-caryophyllene across these botanicals enables legal cannabinoid system modulation without cannabis
legal_cannabinoid_modulation.skin_cream: Imphepho-based provides CB2 activation topically for anti-inflammatory and wound healing effects
legal_cannabinoid_modulation.liver_tonic: Yin Chen Hao-based provides CB2 activation internally for hepatoprotective and systemic anti-inflammatory effects
legal_cannabinoid_modulation.space_paste: Formulations can incorporate either or both for enhanced effects

section_7_dry_herb_vaporization.title: Dry Herb Vaporization Profiles
section_7_dry_herb_vaporization.advantages: No extraction needed, direct plant material use, temperature control enables selective compound release
recommendations: Imphepho: Excellent candidate - releases terpenes cleanly at lower temperatures, including CB2-active β-caryophyllene
Artemisia capillaris: Releases volatile scoparone and essential oils effectively
Cannabis + Mucuna blend: Mucuna provides sublingual/oral L-DOPA absorption while cannabis provides the vaporized cannabinoids
Harsh herbs: Lower vaporization temperatures produce smoother vapor than combustion

section_8_extraction_methods.title: Extraction and Processing Methods
available_equipment: Distillation apparatus (steam distillation for essential oils/hydrosols)

tier_1_simple_infusions.method: Mason jars with botanical + carrier oil or VG/PG. Long steep time (weeks). Filter through silk screens

tier_2_steam_distillation.method: Steam distillation of Imphepho, Artemisia, Sage. Collect essential oil + hydrosol. Add essential oil to VG/PG base or carrier oils

tier_3_solvent_extraction.method: Ethanol extraction (with ascorbic acid for L-DOPA). Evaporate ethanol. Reconstitute in VG/PG or carrier oil

tier_4_acid_base_extraction.method: Acidic aqueous extraction, basification, non-polar solvent pull
tier_4_acid_base_extraction.works_for: Alkaloids and amino acids in freebase forms

distillation_priorities: Priority 1 - Imphepho Essential Oil: High value (South African Helichrysum not commercially available), use in skin formulations and wound healing
Priority 2 - Yerba Lena Yesca: Liver support tinctures, nootropic stack support, Space Paste adjunct
Priority 3 - White Sage: When wild-sourced; high thujone content requires careful dosing

section_9_wax_theurgic.title: Wax and Theurgic Material Applications
section_9_wax_theurgic.description: Wax serves as theurgic material in temple traditions, not merely practical. This connects the cold cream and saponified wax work to the broader Van Kush Family temple pharmacopoeia framework.
historical_applications: Egyptian ushabti: Wax figures for afterlife service
Phoenician/Punic binding tablets: Wax seals curses and prayers
European poppets: Wax dolls for sympathetic magic
Ecclesiastical seals: Wax authenticates sacred documents
wax_properties: Holds intention: Moldable, inscribable, takes form
Preserves: Antimicrobial, seals against air and contamination
Transforms: Melts with heat, releases contents
Penetrates: Carries fat-soluble compounds into skin
current_applications: Cold cream formulations combine wax with botanical oils for transdermal delivery
Saponified wax preparations create cleansing products with preserved botanical actives
Wax amulets and ritual objects continue the temple tradition
T hieroglyph research (wax rather than bread interpretation) connects Egyptian practices to current work

distillation_ready.notes: South African species; authentic ukuphahla material from SA merchant
= Yin Chen Hao; marketed as psychoactive but actually liver medicine
L-DOPA source; requires aqueous extraction for VG/PG use
Wild collection pending; consider cultivated sources

key_concepts.cannabinoid_oilahuasca: Combining cannabinoids with MAGL/FAAH inhibitors to potentiate endocannabinoid signaling
key_concepts.beta_caryophyllene_unification: Dietary CB2 agonist present across multiple inventory botanicals enabling legal cannabinoid modulation
key_concepts.edible_cosmeceutical: Dual-use preparations that work both topically and orally
key_concepts.calendula_AREDS2: Natural lutein/zeaxanthin source functioning as eye health formula
key_concepts.liver_brain_axis: Hepatoprotective herbs supporting brain function through metabolic pathways
key_concepts.theurgic_wax: Wax as consciousness interface material in temple traditions
